ЁЯПЫя╕П
Zenith of Vakataka Power

Most powerful ruler of the Vakataka dynasty. After the decline of the main branch, he reunited both branches and expanded the empire. According to the Ajanta inscription, he conquered Kuntala, Avanti, Kalinga, Kosala, Trikuta, Lata, and Andhra.

ЁЯОи
Ajanta Caves

Caves 16, 17, and 19 of Ajanta (Mahayana Buddhist caves) were built during his reign and by his ministers (like Varahadeva). The golden age of Ajanta's painting, a UNESCO World Heritage site, was during his time.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • End: After him, Vakataka power rapidly declined, and the Kalachuris and Chalukyas took their place.
  • Note: Do not confuse him with Harishena, the court poet of Samudragupta.
